item.title: Elections | Campaign advances for the last days to the “Mpop” style
item.description:
The elections for the Legislative Assembly are scheduled for the 14th, so the election campaign is almost over. In a report by Lusa agency, there are details of the “MPOP” style of the election campaign, with a lot of music and requests for financial support to the mixture
Crowded audience, all dressed in the gowns on the list with which they compete for the elections on the 14th; Chinese drums next to the stage and above candidates and supporters, various microphones, music and choreography. This is the campaign for Macao legislatures, in a style that can be called "MPOP". The microphones change hands, reproducing the same slogans with different voices, in short and acute scales, which end almost all in a party instruction. At this point, the drums are listened to loudly and the audience reproduces the last note heard, while shaking the political 'merchandising' that is handed over to the start of the rally: plastic hands to clap, numbers on the list with led lights, malleable straws, fans, all with the same color. Campaign actions in Macao, restricted to the last two weeks before legislative elections for the local parliament, do not contain speeches in the events of the six lists that will elect 14 of the 33 deputies to the Legislative Assembly (AL). The remaining 12 candidates are chosen through the associations, through the indirect suffrage, and there are still seven deputies appointed by the Chief Executive, in this case Sam Hou Fai. Describing campaign events is like an exercise of musical shows, namely the genus "Kpop", among the lists led by younger candidates, or the genre "pop old-myle", as if it was figures like Elvis or Olivia Newton John Risen. The concentrations are made up of the members of the lists and the people mobilized by them, some and the other dresses with the same uniforms. But there are no politicians on stage and viewers listening to them. In these events, politicians seem to be assumed as artists, but there are no audiences, because they seem to be part of the choreography. Finally, there are very few people besides and each other, that is, people watching who are not directly linked to the lists. Abstention is the great ghost that hangs over the whole process, which takes place for the first time under the framework of the new Electoral Law of April 2024, which aims to "reinforce the implementation of the" Macao Macao governed by Patriotas "principle. Economic challenges Ilia Chou, 40, an employee of the financial sector, was with a child and a friend watching one of these rallies and seemed to be one of those few people present not involved in the campaign list. He agreed to talk to Lusa after he had spoken to another microphone. Ilia was attracted to the list that was there because those people have a "young and community aspect" and are concerned with "offering prospects for progress" to young people. "Given the current challenging economic climate, we face a critical question: our young people now have fewer options than before. This specific aspect is what attracts me most in this initiative," he said. But “other groups also talk about youth and employment, what are the differences? Why do you like this particular group?” We asked. "I don't know them [the other groups]. Well, I was attracted to the charming characters of this list," he replied. "I think these four characters quite charming," Ilia added, they talk about "love, the title is very charming, and the color is pink, it looks very welcoming." Political programs are, without exception, lists of requests to an “provider father”, incarnated by the executive, who has the responsibility of managing a comfortable and growing financial reserve, fueled by taxes paid by the six game dealers in Macao. The numbers show this comfort. In August, the Macao Financial Reserve, which was always growing throughout the first half, reached 647.3 billion patacas, and was applied in subcontracted investments, deposits, current accounts, and credit securities. Lists want to be applied to initiatives such as creating a development fund and reversing 10 percent of profits for distribution by all citizens, want to increase pensions or more money in consumer coupons, subsidies and maternity licenses, want more social housing, want free health and higher education, or simply require greater annual money distribution. Pasta There are also other requirements, such as promoting the diversification of the economy, measures to support the transformation and modernization of small and medium -sized enterprises or development of the intelligent city, but the most significant part of the six lists shows directly to the government's distribution of money in the most varied forms. The other recipients of the requests are the game dealers, to which the candidates go with warnings that they are determined to defend the priority of residents in access to the best paid jobs. Macao's unemployment rate is 2 percent and permanent residents at 2.6 percent. That is, technically, Macau has full employment. However, as Lusa told a candidate, the employment issue has nothing to do with statistics, it just holds on with "perception." And in fact the question of unemployment, especially those who have just graduated, is a pressing issue of political programs, as HM indicated. This is the case of the first list to compete for direct suffrage, the “Association of United Citizens of Macao”, which is led by Song Pek Kei, a deputy linked to the Fujian community, who took the first steps in politics alongside businessman Chan Meng Kam. The list led by the deputy asks, for example, the creation of a share for residents in all professional areas, “support for jobs and local companies”, and the guarantee that “85 percent, or more, employees are local residents”. The Nova Esperança list, led by José Pereira Coutinho, and one of the few macanese participants in these elections, asks for “employment for all”, a slogan present in his electoral program where the “employment priority for Macao's permanent residents is promised at game dealers”. Who goes out to their List campaigns for indirect suffrage may seem more discreet, but that doesn't mean there is no news. After investing in Global Media, Portugal, and betting on the real estate area, in Porto, Kevin Ho, the nephew of the first chief executive, Edmund Ho, bet on local politics, when entering the list “Union of Macao Business Interests”, led by José Chui Sa Peng. Also he is familiar, in this case, from a previous head of the Executive of MSAR, Chui Sai On, already removed from the political scene. In the case of these lists, representative of the sectors of labor, culture, education or business interests, employment is a concern, but what the candidates are looking for is a government that can support companies and finally diversify the economy. Thus, in the “union of business interests of Macao”, it is advocated “support for digital and high technology transformation to modernize traditional industries and develop emerging sectors”. Candidates promise to play the role of intermediaries between those who have difficulty maintaining in this business fabric and the executive by “listening carefully to the difficulties and claims of the commercial and financial industries, especially small and medium enterprises”. The names of the seven appointed deputies are not yet known, as the Chief Executive's choice is usually made public only after the elections. A.S.S. / Portuguese

item.title: Cinema | Hong Kong Movies Shown for the second time in Lisbon
item.description:
Former resident of Macau Vanessa Pimentel is the artistic director of the second edition of the Hong Kong Film Festival, which will take place from 25 to 28 September at the Ideal Cinema in Lisbon. "Making Waves - Navigators of Hong Kong" will present films like "Papa", the documentary "Four Trails" and the restored copy of "Ah Ying", 1983
There are six films, four fiction and two documentaries, which promise to show the best of the best in Hong Kong cinema. This is the second edition of the Hong Kong Film Festival, taking place in Lisbon, at the ideal cinema, between 25 and 28 September, which has as artistic director Vanessa Pimentel, also she director, former resident of Macau linked to producer Blue Lotus Lisboa. In addition to the exhibitions, the Portuguese public will be able to closely see Hong Kong actors, directors and producers, in a proof that it is possible to establish ties between Portugal and different cinematic environments. This year's poster consists of “Papa”, a 2024 film by director Philip Yung that will be screened on the 25th, a Thursday. Follows Ray Yueng's “All Shall Be Well”; Rikki Choy's “Never Too Late”; Montages of A Chan Oliver Siu Kuen; Four Trails, a 2023 documentary directed by Robin Lee. To end the beauty festival, the restored copy of Allen Fong's “Ah Ying” will be projected from “Ah Ying”, a 1983 movie. Vanessa Pimentel explained to HM that the show has “a program that comes from Hong Kong”, where it has been around since 2022. “It is an itinerant program that aims to promote Hong Kong cinema, especially the cinema made by younger filmmakers in terms of experience, although programs always contain more veteran performance works,” he said. This year, besides Lisbon, the Hong Kong Film Festival will pass through cities such as Berlin, Paris, Montreal and Udine, Italy. The event may be linked to Asian movie festivals or not. And it's the intention of Vanessa and Blue Lotus to create an Asian Film Festival in Lisbon, and Macau cinema will be part of it. "In our case, the show is not associated with any festival because it does not yet exist, but I hope to be able to do so," he said. “I was born and raised in Lisbon, but I come from Macau, and my life from Macau is very close to all this. Of course an Asian Film Festival in Lisbon has to include Macau, nor could it be otherwise.” “We do this program with a view to going a little further, and we are putting on an eye on the creation of an Asian Film Festival,” he said. "We haven't done it yet, we have to continue to work, but I think we're on the way." Vanessa Pimentel says that, although she no longer lives in the territory, she is still very linked to the cinema that is done here. “I'm going to Macau at least twice a year, and I've been in permanent contact with movie people. They are all aware of our program [at the Hong Kong movie show] and there is a relationship.” Film We ask the artistic director of the show to talk about what the public can see in the small room of the ideal cinema, which works independently, without connection with large film screenings, which is located in the heart of Bairro Alto. "Papa", which opens the festival, is described "as a very strong and good movie that talks about mental health and has an amazing approach." Vanessa Pimentel describes that this movie was awarded in Hong Kong with the distinction of best actor, presenting themselves throughout the plot "a very particular narrative." “All Shall Be Well” is again shown in Lisbon, after the presentation at the Queer International Film Festival, and has passed Berlin. “It's a very good movie, there was no more screening after being in Berlin, I thought it would be interesting to put it on the program.” Vanessa Pimentel also highlights the presentation of the restored copy of "Ah Ying", which belongs "to the new place of Hong Kong cinema", which shows a story that wanders incessantly between "fiction and documentary." It is a "very interesting movie in which the story is inspired by the story of the actress's own [Hui So Ying] who plays him." The second show of Hong Kong's cinema will be attended by Hui So Ying. "It's a great honor because the actress will make a giant trip. She is already some age, but has soon came to come. It will be very interesting to have a movie inspired by her life and count on her presence to share with us this moment," said Vanessa Pimentel. Little known paths Another highlight of the Film Show is the exhibition of the documentary “Four Trails”, which has been “a ticket phenomenon”. It is a movie about the 298-kilometer race for the four best known Hong Kong tracks. The film portrays a daily reality "from the Hong Kong regions that almost no one knows." "It's a movie about the challenge of sports and people who, not being professional sportsmen, sign up and run, training all year long. It's interesting to see the challenge they propose and how they live," said Vanessa Pimentel, who also highlights "Never Too Late", "A movie about our relationship with the environment." Here one can glimpse "a very Asian and Chinese side of this perspective of what the environment is and what our relationship with nature is like." There is later the "Montage of A Modern Motherhood", a movie that "has been playing the festivals a lot." “It's a movie that has a very interesting side, about motherhood and a perspective that, perhaps, may not be so romantic, about the idea that maternity is not just a sea of ​​roses, having any reverse,” says Vanessa Pimentel. Here the artistic director of the show warns that the film “can challenge a little,” playing “in things that concern everyone, like this thing of family tradition and sharing in motherhood and paternity”. Vanessa Pimentel assures that the first edition of the show was a success, with "about a thousand people going to the cinema in four days." "It was surprising to see a lot of new people, older and also many people of Chinese origin, that is, children of immigrants, eventually a second generation, who were born in Lisbon, speak Portuguese and live here with families. We had sessions with many Chinese to ask questions at the end of the sessions and had never seen it in Lisbon," he said. Hong Kong's cinema show also comes to the script of viewers who usually go to festivals. "We have a very interesting audience, consisting of people who like cinema and go to other festivals. It is not often to see a program that, in Lisbon, focuses on Asian cinema. We have Doc Lisboa, or Indie, but in its programming the proportion of this cinema is much smaller. Between the Hong Kong Film Festival and the future festival, the official says there is “exhibition space” in Lisbon and Portugal, because the Asian cinema is “very vast and rich, having a very high quantity and quality relationship”.

item.title: DSEDJ | Manuals should look at the country's linguistic political

item.title: Social Security Fund | Luís Gomes appointed vice president
item.description:
With the commission as president of the Institute of Sport to come to an end, LAM chose to appoint Luís Gomes as vice president of the Social Security Fund. The name of the new responsible for the sports portfolio was not revealed
The current president of the Institute of Sport (ID), Luís Gomes, will be transferred and assume the duties of vice-president of the Board of Directors of the Social Security Fund (FSS), from Saturday. The decision, which appears signed by the secretary for social affairs and culture, LAM, was published yesterday in the official bulletin, and implies a dispromotion. The publicly released order does not present the reasons for the departure of the ID, merely justifying the transfer to the FSS with the fact that the secretary considers that the leader has “professional competence” and “aptitude to exercise office”. However, these justifications are a form of public appointments. Luís Gomes had been appointed vice president of ID in November 2023, after about 12 years linked to the Directorate of Youth Education and Development Services (DSEDJ). However, with Macao being chosen as one of the places that will host the national games, then ID president, Pun Weng Kun, was transferred to the lead in Macao of the organization of the event, opening the place for the promotion of Luís Gomes. As a result, the young leader assumed ID's rudder, first as a substitute president, but later in the service committee regime, which now came to an end. Luís Gomes' promotions also occurred during the administration of Ho Iat Seng. Yesterday was not made public the name of the new president of ID, who currently has two vices, law Si Leng, appointed in service committee, and Mok Chi Hang, who is a substitute vice president. Education and Sport As vice president of the Social Security Fund, Luís Gomes will work in an area further from his training and professional path. The leader is a degree in Physical Education and Sports at the Macao Polytechnic Institute and has a master's degree in Education Sciences (Physical Education and Sports) from the University of Macau. According to information published in the official bulletin, he entered the civil service in September 2011, where he stayed until November 2023. At the entity that regulates local education, it performed the duties of superior technician, director of the Center for Youth Areia Preta Activities and the Juvenile Activities Center of the Hippadromo neighborhood, head of the School Sports and Occupation Division, Head of the Youth Association Training and Support Division, Head of the Youth Development Division, Head of the General Student Development Division and the Chief of the Non -Superior Education Department.

item.title: Lag | Pereira Coutinho calls for wages and social support
item.description:
Pereira Coutinho defends the increase in wages in the civil service, but also in the concessionaires of the game. The winner of recent legislative elections also suggested reinforcing public expense to increase support to the population, starting with the cash check
It assumes that it has barely slept since, on Sunday, managed to elect, with the new hope list, three deputies in Hemiciclo. José Pereira Coutinho is still celebrating Sunday's overwhelming victory and the fact that he sat back in the Legislative Assembly (AL) next to Che Sai Wang and Chan Hao Weng. The trio was yesterday on the morning program of the Chinese channel of Rádio Macau to defend wage increases, now that the government is preparing for the elaboration of the Lines of Governing Action (LAG) for next year. Coutinho said, on the sidelines of the program, to expect "that the salaries of the workers of the civil service, the TDM itself and the concessionaires", as well as defend "the increase of public spending in terms of distribution of consumer cards." "The six dealers have this year updated the salaries, but the civil service was in the way. We sent a letter to the government, which is currently preparing the budget for 2026, and we expect a salary update to improve the purchasing power of civil service workers and retirees," said Coutinho. The deputy was more specific and pointed to a climb of "three to five points of the Indian table, the minimum for the recovery of purchasing power." As for the minimum wage, Coutinho said in the program that he should go beyond 34 patacas per hour. "It can't be so, Hong Kong's minimum wage is more than 40 dollars of Hong Kong per hour. The government must assume the leading role to increase the minimum wage," he said. Blurr Checks The elected deputy said that the executive should bet “in the return of the 21,000 patacas for the elderly”, without forgetting the increase in the value of pecuniary checks. In his view, “they are effective policies to increase consumption in Macao and counterbalance residents' trip to consume beyond borders,” he defended TDM-Radio Macau. In turn, Chan Hao Weng said he expected more guarantees for teachers in the reform phase, namely a monthly subsidy for retired teachers. The deputy who will debut in the Legislative Assembly and the repeate Che Sai also spoke of the importance of creating more job opportunities for residents, arguing that there are still many jobs occupied by non-residents.

item.title: Brands | New classification seeks to promote commerce
item.description: To promote consumption and relaunch the economy, the direction of economics and technological development services has launched a new classification system for small and medium enterprises. The new program of classification and distinction of the brands was presented yesterday at a press conference. According to the presentation of the new system, reported by Rádio Macau's Chinese channel, the aim of the new classification is to value more local brands and businesses, while trying to create new tourist attractions that promote consumption and take tourists to community neighborhoods. The new classifications are divided into three categories “Centenary brand”, “typical brand of Macau” and “stores with specialized and delicate characteristics”. In the first phase, only 100 small and medium -sized companies can be classified as “stores with specialized and delicate features”. These will receive financial supports that can reach 150 thousand patacas, to finance 60 percent of online marketing campaigns, creative decoration processes and the launch of patented products. Regarding the categories “Centenary brand” and “typical brand of Macao” the candidacy are not limited and are open. The Macau Chain Stores and Franchise Association will watch in the application process.

item.title: Elections | Caeal validates 24 votes previously declared null
item.description:
The Electoral Affairs Commission of the Legislative Assembly validated 24 votes that had previously been considered null, all linked to direct suffrage. The lists of Coutinho and Song Pek Kei were thus with more votes
The results of Sunday elections that led to the choice of deputies to the Legislative Assembly (AL) are closed. The Commission of Electoral Affairs of the Legislative Assembly (Caeal) yesterday presented the data on the polls, and one of the changes involves validation of 24 votes previously considered invalid. From this universe, eight had been contested by the lists and 16 considered null, before reversal. Cheang Kok Chi, president of Caeal's general finding assembly, explained that "the 24 invalid votes that have been valid are of direct suffrage and [change] did not damage the order or the results." "At each voting assembly, after finishing the vote, the table has a preliminary decision on the votes, where some can be decided on immediately. There are members of the lists present to see whether or not to protest this decision, so there are two types of situations," he said. Thus, the Nova Esperança list, led by José Pereira Coutinho and who was becoming the great winner of the elections, putting three deputies in Hemiciclo, won six more votes with this change, because in the preliminary determination on Sunday the list was 43,361 votes. Also the Macao United Citizens Association list, led by Song Pek Kei, won five more votes from 29,459 votes registered on Sunday's count to 29,464 votes released yesterday. The blank votes ciphed at 5,987, representing 3.42 percent, while the null votes were 7053, representing 4.02 percent. The Caeal official assured that the law "also expressly provides that, during the vote, people [members of the candidates] lists may be present beyond the members of the vote and assistant assembly." A WAY OF WORKING Cheang Kok Chi did not give a clear justification that the null votes are not shown, evoking the duty of confidentiality, although the practice is common to the previous elections. "As for the fact that the votes are not identified, before we do the qualifying work we never know what the votes are like. Taking this into consideration, we chose this way to do our finding work," he said.

item.title: Geotourism and themed parks - 2nd part
item.description: Connie Kong, as a director of the theme park at Lisbon Macau, has played a key role in defining the park's operational view and in the strategy of involvement with the community. His leadership reflects a strong commitment to the integration of local culture into the entertainment experience, ensuring that the park not only has fun, but also identifies with the collective identity of Macao residents. Under its direction, Lisbon Macau has actively supported local SMEs through initiatives such as the business connection session, promoting economic inclusion and reinforcing the role of the park as a socially responsible entity in the region. Christine Hong Barbosa and Sophia Mok played equally fundamental roles in expanding the presence and purpose of Lisbon Macao. As vice president of marketing and retail development, Christine Hong Barbosa has created buying experiences that combine nostalgia with innovation, positioning the park as a destination that honors Macao's past while embracing his future. In turn, Sophia Mok, Vice President of Sales and Corporate Communication, has been essential in the construction of strategic partnerships and the elaboration of narratives that highlight the cultural relevance of the park and its community-centered philosophy. Together, their contributions helped establish Lisbon Macau not only as a thematic attraction, but as a significant space that celebrates local heritage and promotes pride among Macao residents. Lisbon Macao transcends conventional entertainment offers. It proposes a true sensory cartography, where each attraction is designed to dialogue with the territory, collective memory and local culture. It is an experiential model that surpasses the paradigm of Asian thematic parks by integrating body, space and narrative in a proposal for identity cultural tourism. The attractions are not mere leisure devices but they are also instruments of territorial reading, historical evocation and emblematic diplomacy. Each is conceived as a chapter of a larger narrative, where the visitor not only consumes, but participates, interprets and transforms. Lisbon Macau offers experiential narratives such as Zipcity Macau that stands out as a moving geography. Being the first urban zip line of Macao, it is more than an attraction of adrenaline, as it is an aerial installation that crosses the hotel skyline, offering visitors a panoramic reading of the urban landscape. Overcoming Facades inspired by Macao from the 1960s, the visitor's body becomes a vehicle for space recognition. Experience is not only physical but also cartographic, aesthetic and symbolic. Zipcity transforms space into show and movement into interpretation. Goairborne Macau represents the body as an instrument of territoriality. This indoor parachDism simulator is an unprecedented technological and sensory innovation in the region. By combining augmented wind tunnel technology, the experience simulates the flight over the city, reinforcing the connection between body and territory. The visitor not only feels but also flies, observes and understands. Goairborne is a metaphor for air perspective, living cartography and experiential geography. Line Friends Presents House of Friend embodies pop culture as transnational diplomacy. This thematic space dedicated to Asian pop culture is more than a merchandising center because it acts as a cultural diplomacy platform, attracting young audiences and connecting Macau to transnational networks of symbolic consumption. Its playful environment, iconic characters and contemporary aesthetics create an experience that transcends borders, reinforcing the park's cosmopolitan dimension. Maison L'Occitane represents nature as a sensory experience. The first thematic unit of the brand in hotel context is a work of sensory design. Rooms are inspired by natural ingredients such as lavender, verbena and cherry flower, offering a stay that connects visitors to the aromatic landscapes of Provence. This proposal is not only aesthetic but also therapeutic, ecological and symbolic. Maison L'Occitane turns the rest room into ritual, and hospitality into botanical experience. The MX4D Cinemas Emperor is an image as a territorial immersion. Equipped with movement technology, aromas and tactile effects, it provides a multisensory film experience. The films are carefully selected to reinforce territorial and cultural narratives, positioning space as a protagonist. The visitor not only watches but also participates, feels, smells and vibrates. Cinema becomes an extension of the park, and the image, an instrument of immersion. The H853 Fun Factory fuses international brands with design inspired by the city's futuristic aesthetics, and it is not only a commercial space but also a living museum, commercial gallery, and evocation of urban modernity. Each store, each showcase, each corridor is designed to tell a story, rebuild a time and turn the act of buying into a memory gesture. Geogostronomy in Lisbon Macau is not a complementary service but a language that translates the territory into flavor, memory in revenue and landscape into sensory experience. The kitchen practiced in Lisbon is a living extension of the theme park, where each dish is a cartography, each ingredient an evocation, and each technique a bridge between tradition and innovation. The gastronomic proposal is deeply rooted in the sino-Portuguese fusion that defines Macau, but is not limited to reproducing historical recipes. Here, cooking is understood as creative act and gesture of territorial interpretation. Complex restaurants not only feed but also narrate, educate and celebrate. At Stanley’s Café, for example, the elegance of memory is palpable. The decoration is inspired by twentieth-century colonial coffees, with dark woods, soft lighting and details that evoke the salons of Canton and Lisbon tea. But it is in the kitchen that true cultural alchemy is revealed, where flavors and stories intertwine to offer visitor a simultaneously intimate and universal experience. Cuisine Raymond's chef, a reference figure in Macao's Thematic Gastronomy, features creations that are true identity synthesis such as cod chau-chau rice, cream pastels infused with jasmine tea, and desserts that reinterpret Portuguese classics with local ingredients. Your approach combines technical rigor with historical sensitivity. Each dish is conceived as a narrative, tribute and gesture of gastronomic diplomacy. Stanley's is not just a coffee but an edible memory space, where the territory is saved. The decoration evokes colonial halls, but it is in the kitchen that cultural alchemy transforms the taste into a historical reading tool. Royal Palace represents high gastronomy as sensory cartography. Here, gastronomy reaches the art status. Tasting menus are conceived as taste itineraries that cross coastal waters, local markets and ancestral knowledge. Ingredients such as depth shrimp, regional black pig and carefully cultivated aromatic herbs are treated with accuracy and respect. Royal Palace's kitchen is not only sophisticated but is territorial. Each dish states Macau as a creative space, gastronomic territory, a city that thinks through taste. The restaurant contributes directly to the recognition of Macau as a “creative city of gastronomy by UNESCO” not only for technical excellence, but for the ability to transform the place into universal language. Angela Café & Lounge embodies the delicacy of the signature kitchen. Experience is defined by elegance, serenity and accuracy. Under the direction of Executive Chef António Coelho and Cuisine's chef Sally Jimenez, the space offers a culinary approach that raises local ingredients through contemporary techniques. The dishes are delicate, balanced and deeply sensory. Chef António, with classical formation and contemporary vision, works sober and deeply. Chef Sally, with aesthetic sensitivity and technical mastery, transforms each dish into a visual and taste composition. Together they create a kitchen simultaneously intimate and universal, local and cosmopolitan. Angela Café & Lounge is more than a meal space but a geogogogeneous laboratory, where the territory is interpreted with delicacy and rigor. None of these experiences would be possible without Terence Chu's institutional view as vice president of Lisbon Macau's Food and Beverages Department, Terence leads with strategic intelligence, cultural sensitivity and commitment to excellence. Not only coordinates operations but draws experiences. Its ability to integrate chefs, spaces, narratives and public transforms the food sector of Lisbon Macao on the central axis of its thematic proposal. Under its guidance, gastronomy has evolved from service to language and function to mission. His work represents the elevation of gastronomy in thematic tourism, raising it to the status of cultural diplomacy and territorial innovation. Macao's recognition as a “creative city of gastronomy by UNESCO” is partly a reflection of his vision and dedication. Geogostronomy practiced at Lisbon Macau is a unique model in the international panorama. By integrating territory, memory, technique and narrative, the complex transforms food into cultural experience, a gesture of recognition and the act of creation. This project has no direct parallel in any other hotel theme park in the world. It deserves authorial recognition and institutional acclamation as an international reference in gastronomic tourism with identity.

item.title: Sex: A strategy for self-knowledge
item.description: Sex is a mirror for weaknesses and a path to self-knowledge. More than pleasure, sex unites what is normally separated: the melting process tests the porosity of personal boundaries. It becomes in a portal for deeper vulnerabilities and difficulties. What reveals most is the form (and the difficulty) we have to connect with others. It will not be admired, sexual vulnerability implies physical, emotional and symbolic exposure at the same time. It exposes the skin, the imperfections and exposes the fear of rejection, the difficulty in asking, the shame of desires and emotions that do not seem "normal". Sex as a cultural artifact is an attempt to produce protective masks to this discomfort. There is a clear association of sex with the aesthetics of the superficial. It is the dominance of non-real, the dressed, the bodies and the lives that are paved by social networks, the early plastic surgeries of young people who want to look in a certain way. Pornography, the only source of “education” that young people probably have currently live on fantasy and unrealistic expectations. These images not only shape the way we show ourselves, but also aggravate the difficulty in exposing ourselves as we are - vulnerability is masked by a performance of perfection. I had a friend who was lying down and woke up earlier than his partner to touch up make -up so that he always saw his best version: will there be greater resistance than this? That is why talking about sex should be encouraged, because in the midst of so much confusion it is much easier to grasp dogmas that deficiently explain how sex manifests parts of us that we do not want to look. There are wishes, desires, and non -articulated fears that are repressed at the bottom of the being and that remain there forever, without even giving room to realize what they say of us. I recently found a heading in The Guardian newspaper that seemed to me a step in the opposite direction. First, for inviting couples to share their sex stories; Second, for valuing the creative forms they find to deal with human encounters and mismatches. For example, one of the couples says that, in the middle of an approximation and an intense but doubtful relationship, they decided to take a break in sex for three months and assumed the distance as a space to rediscover themselves in the relationship - which worked. This work of making sense of vulnerability, instead of letting sexual experience remaining in the emptiness, prevents people from feeling alone and lost, without realizing why sex can be such an intense trigger for experiences that they cannot explain - for emotions whose origin escapes them. Communication patterns, power imbalances, proximity and distancing: everything recreates in sex. The room becomes a stage where they are repeated, in miniature, the same emotional games we live in everyday life. Of course Kink, sexual games, fetishes and roller-play have this much more assumed symbolic dimension, with a deeper understanding that it is necessary to express sensations, emotions and content in safe and container spaces (e.g. BDSM). I don't stop being stupidly optimistic in the desire to work on sex as a path to self-discovery. It is precisely in the game between fragility and power that resides the paradox of sex - place of immobilization and movement. When it is used as this metaphorical portal for self-knowledge, I guarantee: The result is impressive. For those who want to think more about themselves, they can start with simple questions. How do I position myself about sex? How is my relationship with pleasure? How do I like to be seduced? What emotions do you evoke? How do I react to them? And, more importantly, how can a more open and conscious view of sex allow the desired changes in the way we relate to each other? It is in the space between the vulnerability and the liberation of sex that we find perhaps the best metaphor of what is human being.

item.title: Fine unconsciousness (II)
item.description: Last week, we analyzed the measures carried out in Shenzhen, mainland China, in the form of fines imposed under the “regulations on the establishment in Shenzhen Dapeng of the first natural disaster prevention decree in China.” This punitive measure was first applied to China in the framework of this regulation. The fines were passed on to two tourists because they "invaded a restricted area" during a blue alert raised by meteorology services. Hong Kong and Macau also have legislation to ban entries in restricted areas. These regulations share a characteristic: they are intended to prevent the entry into restricted areas without authorization. However, there is no legislation to regulate the practice of dangerous activities such as persecution and tuffles and surfing. In September 2013, Typhoon Usagi reached Hong Kong. Some people risk their lives to dive into the storm, be pushed by the wind to the point of not being able to walk, are completely soaked and still exclaimed, "that fix! This is so exciting!" A boy even declared, "Young people, if they don't live now, will they live when?" A woman took pictures with Usagi. While the young people enjoyed the wind, their parents took their children to the beach to "observe the waves." On the Star Ferry quay in Tsim Sha Tsui, gigantic waves packed the coast every half dozen seconds, and the "wave observers" were extremely excited and applauded loud and sound. Some couples even danched in the middle of the Borrasca, while others just took two -story wave photographs. During a natural disaster, if someone neglects security, for personal pleasure, has dangerous behavior in areas considered to be disaster or getting stuck and needing to be rescued put your life in danger and that of others. It is known that those who work in rescue operations in very hard circumstances have a high probability of taking serious risks. In 2017, the Hong Kong Yau Siu-Min Firefighter died during a rescue in MA on Shan. One of the people being rescued was an out -of -service police officer. Although later he was apologized to the deceased's family, stating that he had overvalued his abilities and had not paid attention to the warning "the entry is not allowed," none of this prevented Yau's death. Society can pass various laws to punish those who have dangerous behaviors such as diving in the center of the storms, observing waves, taking photographs during typhoons and neglecting personal safety during natural disasters, and requiring them to pay the costs of rescue operations. However, there are several points that should be considered when legislates. First, how to define dangerous behavior? The legislation that prohibits, during the occurrence of natural disasters, entrances into risk areas, circulation in bridges, entry into natural parks is easy to apply. Entry into restricted areas is simply prohibited. Dangerous behaviors such as exposing yourself to weather, observing waves, taking pictures during the passage of typhoons, although easy to understand, are difficult to define from the legal point of view. For example, a person may be on the beach during a typhoon watching the horizon, but does the wind feel? Are you watching the waves, or are you doing anything else? The simpler the more difficult behavior is to define from a legal point of view. Without definition of specific acts, it is difficult to regulate them legally and further process someone for these practices. Because these acts are so simple, it is not easy to list all dangerous behaviors when they make law proposals and some omissions are inevitable. It is predictable that laws intended to regulate hazardous behaviors, need to be continuously reviewed after promulgation to cover a greater variety of hazardous behaviors. Both China and Macau use the statutory law, which requires legal changes through regulatory procedures. The more the laws are magazines, the greater the number of procedures involved and the higher the costs. Hong Kong implements the system of consumetudinary law through basic law. Courts can review the definition of the different dangerous behaviors based on precedents. Although this legal framework reduces the number of times the Hong Kong government has to review the laws, the costs remain more or less equal; Simply passes the alteration of ordinances to the definition of hazardous behaviors through jurisprudence. Whether it is to rescue people who have entered risk areas or save those involving dangerous activities during the occurrence of natural disasters, rescue teams need many people and a large amount of specialized equipment. Rescue operations costs are high and beyond the reach of ordinary people. While we can promulgate laws that force those who neglect their own security to bear the save expenses, how can one force to pay that has no money? Lastly, when someone cannot afford, it will have to be the government to cover the costs. Government funds are fed by taxpayers. Therefore, it is ultimately the society that supports the burden. It is not true that society pays the damage caused by those who engage in dangerous activities. Even without legislation, everyone should understand that during a natural disaster, neglect personal safety and practicing walks, surf or aquatic ski puts it at risk but also who will rescue it. Instead of punishing those who risk dangerous behaviors, it is preferable to educate people about the dangers involved and also the potential damage to third parties. By consideration for ourselves and to others, we must keep saved during the occurrence of natural disasters. Keep save without redemption is a service we provide to society. item.title: Lecture and tasting make known Yunnan Tea Culture today at FRC
item.description: The Rui Cunha Foundation today from 18:30, a lecture and ceremony of tea tasting, in an event entitled “The Immaterial Cultural Heritage of Yunnan of Tea Art”. The session, which has free admission, is co-organized by the Yunnan Tea Trader Association in Macao, and has the participation of guest speakers Chen Haoyan, founder of that institution; Zheng Zhanpeng, founder of Tea Company Lao Ban Zhang, Ltd. de Menghai; and Xu Yanting, heiress of the ethnic tea brand “Fire Pond Boiling Water”. The doctor, writer, and usual presence at FRC events, Shee Va will attend the simultaneous interpretation between the Mandarin, Cantonese and Portuguese languages. According to the FRC, the event aims to promote the understanding of the history and origins of the “Lao Ban Zhang” tea from the village with the same name in Menghai County in the southwest of Yunnan province, near the Myanmar border. Located in a mountainous area of ​​1,700 to 1,900 meters of altitude, with an average annual temperature of 18.7 degrees Celsius, Lao Ban Zhang produces one of the rarest and appreciated types of tea Pu'er. Local minorities, such as the BU Lang tribe, have been responsible for tea plantations for centuries in this high region, which remains almost half of the year covered by a dense fog. Tea Pu'er is a variety of traditional fermented tea from Yunnan Province, China, produced from the leaves of the Camellia Sinensis var. ASSAMEMICA. In the context of the production of this variety of Chinese tea, fermentation refers to the microbial process that usually happens after tea leaves have been sufficiently dry and curled in the form of “wet stacking”, allowing them to remain oxidizing until desired flavors are reached. The final test The dissemination of Yunnan's tea art and culture also includes a demonstration and tasting ceremony of “seven infusions”, which will be shared with the public at the FRC gallery, allowing lovers to know their authentic flavor. "Most products currently sold, supermarkets and tea houses, are not pure tea. Consumers are simply buying a rolled -up tea cake on a piece of silk paper, not pure bingdao tea, Lao Ban Zhang or other varieties. The result is a bad and bitter flavor," explains the organizers of the session.

item.title: Green Island | Curb again organize bike rides this month
item.description:
“On the Move VII: Verde Verde Moments” is the name of the center for architecture and urbanism on the 27th of this month. Through bicycle rides between Green Island and Fai Chi Kei is intended to discover the secrets of these places and, from there, produce a video record
Take a bicycle and follow architectural or urbanistic secrets still hidden in the eyes of many. This is what Curb - Center for Architecture and Urbanism proposes, which on September 27 organizes the seventh edition of these tours, with the initiative entitled “On the Move VII: Verde Verde Moments”, which proposes “Creative Bicycle Tours that offer participants the opportunity to explore Green Island”. On the Move is a “unique project that combines creative bike rides with the display of a documentary,” says a note from the organization, and this year the tours “will follow a different direction, with the starting point of the University of São José and exploring a new area of ​​Macao: The Green Island”. The initiative offers an invitation to “discover different neighborhoods around the Verde Island through four journeys commented in English by curator Nuno Soares, president of Curb”. Nuno Soares is also an architect and is linked to architecture teaching at the University of São José. To ride To ride a bicycle on the 27th you must be over 18 years old. The organization provides at the event materials such as helmets, reflective vests and audio receivers. There will be two routes and two sessions of each. The sessions take place between 10am and 11am, and then between 16h and 17h, on the Fai Chi Kei route; And then between 11:30 and 12:30 pm, and between 14:30 and 15:30, on the route of the neighborhood of Toi San. Curb presents itself as a non-profit institution that aims to promote research, education, production and dissemination of knowledge in architecture, urbanism and urban culture. The Center is a platform of exchange between academia, civil society, professional practice and government institutions, serving the interests of the community in general through research studies, workshops, conferences, exhibitions, contests and other initiatives. item.title: Jorge Paiva brings together 100 plants mentioned in the epic work of Camões
item.description: About 100 plants from various continents mentioned by Camões in his work led the botanist Jorge Paiva to reconstruct in a book, available since yesterday, the trips made by the poet in the 16th century between Lisbon and the Far East. Luís de Camões studied first in Coimbra, whose university Jorge Paiva is a jubilated teacher, before leaving North Africa, Mozambique Island, Goa and Macau, a period that partially coincides with the Portuguese navigators saga, a few decades after Vasco da Gama's armed Armada arrived in India in 1498. “Since‘ the Lusíadas ’were written, almost in their entirety, in the East and centered on the discoveries, most of the plants referred to in this poem are Asian, particularly spices and medicinal ones,” explains the scientist. The book “The Plants in the Poetic Work of Camões”, the result of a multi -year investigation, “will be made available in open access on the Press website of the University of Coimbra (IUC),” Carlota Simões director Carlota told Lusa. In the 166 -page study, the biologist states, on the other hand, that in the Lyric of Camões, "mostly written in Portugal and centered on love and passion, the plants referred to are almost all, European, Mediterranean and generally used by poets since classical antiquity." “Some botanical expeditions in which I participated [all over the world] coincided with some of the regions where Camões walked or alluded to their poems,” he explains. The official celebrations of the 500th anniversary of the birth of the creator of “Os Lusíadas”, whose commissioner José Augusto Bernardes, from the University of Coimbra, is underway, the University of Coimbra, the edition of Jorge Paiva's work has been scheduled in the program since the beginning. “At the time Camões lived, the best known and cited plants in literature were more medicinal plants than food and, in poetry, ornamental or mythological relevance,” he writes. 60 plants in the epic work In "Os Lusíadas", according to the environmentalist, about 60 plants are referred to, "many Asian and Aromatic", whereas in the lyric work "much less species", around 40, especially "European, country or ornamental". “Camões knew well the Asian medicinal plants used by Garcia de Orta, not only by reading the 'simple and drug of India'], but also by observing them alive in nature. In addition, (…) I certainly knew Garcia de Orta garden in Goa,” he admits. The investigator, born in Angola in 1933, said that “during his stay in Asia, particularly in Goa, Camões, as well as the botanical and herbal knowledge achieved through living with Garcia de Orta, surely had the opportunity for cultural convivials with distinguished Portuguese and cults” who at the time resided in the colony, annexed by the Indian Union, 1961. In “The Plants in the Poetic Work of Camões”, Jorge Paiva also interprets references to trees, herbs and flowers originating from land that the solid poet never visited, such as Brazil and Timor. "The Portuguese when they saw the Asian red stick, they also called him redwood, but it is the wood of a tree of the tropical forests of East Asia," he exemplifies.

item.title: Restoration | Payments with apps increase in July
item.description: Data from the Directorate of Statistics and Census Services (DSEC) reveal a monthly and annual increase in electronic payments in the restoration business, although breaks in some restaurant segments. In July, payments with electronic media in restaurants were headed at 1.12 billion patacas, an increase in June this year of 5.8 percent. Meanwhile, in the first seven months of the year, the volume of electronic transactions was 7.86 billion patacas, plus 2.5 percent. Where a slight break in transactions, 0.9 percent, was between July and the same month last year. DSEC also points out that last July "the volume of transactions of owners of all the restoration's sub-riders rose to June 2025, due to the effect of summer holidays." The biggest increase was in fast -food restaurants, around 11.4 percent, while in Chinese food restaurants the increase in transactions was 6.7 percent. The only segment that registered increases in the volume of payments, in annual terms, was that of fast food restaurants, “fast food”, with 14.8 percent payments. On the contrary, in food and titus and cannas stores, the fall was 2.3 percent. In the case of payments in Chinese restaurants the annual break was 1.4 percent. DSEC also highlights the fact that the volume of electronic payment transactions in restoration represents about 70 percent of the revenues of this economic branch, while in the retail trade sector represent 80 percent of revenues.

item.title: Crime | Man detained by alleged defamation of athlete Zhu Yuling
item.description:
The Judicial Police announced the arrest of a man accused of defamation, due to online publications and for participating in a campaign that involved lanes to accuse the local athlete not to pay debts
A 51 -year -old man was arrested by police authorities and is indicted for the crime of defamation against athlete Zhu Yuling. The arrest was released on Tuesday afternoon by the Judicial Police (PJ), took place at the border of the doors of the siege. The suspect is resident in the interior of China. According to a police statement, the man had been wanted since Thursday of last week, when Zhu Yuling, only identified in the message of the authorities as a victim, filed a complaint for defamation. The athlete complained of being the target of “several online publications” in which people photographed with T-shirts accusing her not to pay debts. In the publications it was equally possible to see two people opening tracks outside the East Asia Sports Complex, where last week was the Macao Champions Tournament, where the same charges read. The athlete, who represents Macau, was one of the participants in the tournament. After investigating the case, the authorities identified three people involved in the campaign in Macao. However, after the campaign with protests outside the enclosure all came to the interior of China. A few days later, the detainee tried to enter Macao, which provided the authorities the opportunity to advance with the detention. Dívidas desconhecidas When he was questioned by the authorities, the man confessed “not having financial disputes with the athlete, nor to know the people who were photographed with the messages, banners and t-shirts. The detainee also recognized that he received 2,500 Renminbis to carry out the protest actions against the athlete, without verifying the truth of the allegations. The suspicion also confessed that as part of this payment was planned the recruit of the other two men who were photographed and meet Monte inside China. The crime of defamation has as a maximum penalty six months in prison or 240 days of fine. However, depending on the circumstances the penalty may be aggravated up to two years in prison. Zhu Yuling has been accused in recent months of not paying debt, in a case that began in China, with an influencer publishing the accusations in Douyin, the authorized Tiktok version in the country. According to an athlete's statement, the charges will resulted in various abuses and “online violence” while participating in a tournament in the United States. Zhu Yuling is a native of the interior and represented China's selection for over 10 years, reaching the number 1 of the world ranking in 2017. item.title: JLL expects difficulties for investors in stores and offices
item.description: Real Estate Jones Lang Lsalle (JLL) anticipates the continuity of difficult times for investors in commercial spaces such as stores and offices. The forecast appears in the Macao Real Estate Review Report in 2025, whose conclusions appear in an article in the Hong Kong Economic Times. From the perspective of JLL, stores and offices will continue to watch the revenue of rent because the Macao market depends many of the tourists in the interior of China and the consumer power on the other side of the border is in breaking. According to the stores index prepared by the company, the rent value in the first half of this year was reduced by 0.3 percent compared to the end of last year. At the same time, the evaluation value of these properties fell 6.6 percent in annual terms. The report also points out that the debt ratio not paid to trade loans increased to 5.4 percent at the end of June. According to the scenario set by JLL, it is expected that by the end of the year the number of stores for leaseing increases, which is justified with the growing desertification of the community neighborhoods and the transition from the economy to a model without casino-satellites. Offices in crisis Regarding the offices, JLL points out that local companies are increasingly focused on controlling costs and expanding financial and law services within China. For these reasons, the real estate points out that the value of the offices will continue to fall. JLL also estimates that since the first half of the year the offices have lost an average of 4.1 percent of the value compared to the end of last year. In this environment, and according to statements by Mark Wong, the company's senior director, the most advisable investment opportunities are at the hotel. With the prices of the rooms and the hotel occupancy rate, JLL believes they will benefit from the “stable and healthy growth of the game and tourism sector”, so investments will be more profitable. Mark Wong also stated that the market shows confidence in hotel investments and has given the sale of the hotel the 13, which believes to be profitable in the medium and long term.

item.title: Real Estate | August with more sales and more expensive prices
